text.text_translated:
In the 1950s banana growers in the south had a big problem.  
Their bananas that made them the most money were the Gros Michel.  
The Gros Michel had thick skin and sweet taste.  
It was easy to move.  
It grew on many farms.  
United Fruit was the main company in South America.  
The company copied shoots from plant stems instead of planting seeds.  
It grew the bananas close together.  
The Gros Michel plants were dying from a disease.  
Now the same thing is happening with the Cavendish.

It was the most profitable banana.  

Cavendish is a type of banana that came after Gros Michel.  

In the 1950s, growers in Central America saw their best banana die.  
Now the same thing is happening to Cavendish.  

The Gros Michel banana had fruit that was easy to move.  
It had thick skin and sweet taste.  

The plant ruled banana farms in Central America.
